Wang Mansheng 王满晟 (Chinese, born 1962), Silence Series 08-1, 2008. Sheet; ink and color on paper, 76.2 × 56.2 cm. Gift of the Department of Art and Archaeology, Princeton University, in honor of Professor Jerome Silbergeld on the occasion of his retirement

 (2016-23)
Chinese, Western Wei dynasty (535–557), Celestial Maiden (apsara), mid–6th century A.D. Terracotta with pigment, 35 x 12.6 x 9 cm. Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund (y1986-108)

Chinese, Western Wei dynasty (535–557), Celestial Maiden (apsara), holding a lotus blossom, mid-6th century. Terracotta with pigment, 21.3 x 15.6 x 8 cm. Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund (y1986-109)
Chinese, Tang dynasty (618–907), Face of Ananda, an attendant of the Buddha, 700–750. Terracotta with pigment, 13 x 11 x 6.5 cm. Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund (y1986-110)

Chinese, Modern period (1912–present), Xie Chengshui 謝成水 (born 1950), Guanyin: Copy of wall painting from Cave 320 of the Mogao Caves at Dunhuang, ca. 1990. Ink and color on two sheets of paper, 221.1 x 86.6 cm. [Gift of Professor Roderick Whitfield, Graduate School Class of 1965, in honor of James and Lucy Lo] (2011-54)

Chinese, Modern period (1912–present), James C. Lo Workshop, copy after wall painting, Northern Wei dynasty (386–535), Buddhist Tiger Story, 1958–63. Sheet; ink and color on paper, 78.5 × 112 cm; 84.1 × 117.2 × 5.1 cm (frame). Gift of Lucy L. Lo (2013-107)

Chinese, Modern period (1912–present), James C. Lo Workshop, copy after wall painting, High Tang dynasty (704–781), Kasyapa (迦叶尊者), 1958–63. Sheet; ink and color on paper, 78.4 x 55.2 cm; 84.5 × 60.6 × 5.1 cm (frame). Gift of Lucy L. Lo (2012-136)
